Description: Fragment of floor of East Greek black-figured pottery plate, grooved and glazed on the underside. In the tondo, a lion to left, forepart remaining with left forepaw raised; added red on neck and shoulder. Around tondo, pairs of short, vertical bars framed by lines. Inscription at centre of underside
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 21, no. 70, pl. 19)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (pl. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.107)
